name: Europa Royale Riga

reviews.text: We heard that this hotel is comprised of an older part, which generally has larger rooms, and a newer part which has smaller rooms. So any report here of small or large rooms is invalid unless it says where the room was and whether it was standard or deluxe.
reviews.title: Mixed feelings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a standard 2 bedroom in the new section. It had about 220 SF plus a small bathroom. We heard that some rooms were smaller than ours in the new section. The furniture was plain but adequate.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.text: The bath-shower was a problem for us. The bath rim was 22 inches high, making it difficult to get in and out to take a shower. The glass deflector was short, and water flowed on the floor.
reviews.title: Spacious, clean rooms & Good location

reviews.text: The AC was inadequate, and the TV was placed perpendicular to the beds, making it difficult to see.
reviews.title: one of my favourite ones in Riga
Close to Old Town
reviews.text: Service and breakfast were very good.

Girlie trip to Riga 2013 very welcoming fabulous hotel. The staff very good food excellent. But there is a karaoke bar which can be noisy at the weekends if u r in the wrong room. Avoid room 210 and 209 Friday to Sunday. Highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded when we arrived and had a lovely room with high ceilings, elegant furnishings, a nice view and even a terrace. Unfortunately, as mentioned below, we were also directly above the casino/disco and it was extremely loud all night long. I imagine it would be better in a room higher up (we were on the first floor). The breakfast was excellent: buffet-style with lots of choice and options that changed every day, in their lovely restaurant.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in a great location

reviews.text: The staff were all friendly, efficient and helpful.
reviews.title: Second work trip and just as good!

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in a great location, about 10 minutes walk from the Old Town and with plenty of restaurants, bars and shopping in the direct vicinity.
reviews.title: Old in every way (but that´s not all bad)

reviews.text: I would definitely recommend this hotel but do ask for a quiet room as the music is unbearable.
reviews.title: The grandeur, Benjamins restaurant and fast internet makes this my preferred hotel in Riga

reviews.text: We got to stay in this hotel for 357$canadian including taxes for three nights. The complimentary breakfast is wonderful with many choices. The service is very professionnal. This hotel is just beautiful, breakfast is served in elegant old setting chandeliers and all. The most beautiful hotel I have stayed in. The location is within walking distance of the old town and the "art nouveau" section.
reviews.title: Like staying in a palace

reviews.text: This is a good hotel very clean , great location close to the Old Town, near to lots of bars and restaurants. Had the breakfast each morning good selection fresh fruit, pastries etc. They do have a hot food selection, bacon, eggs, sausages but they were cold ever day. The Casino can be very noisy with people coming out at 5am making a lot of noise. Got to say the staff were very good no complaints there.
reviews.title: Good Hotel BUT!!!! Air Baltic

reviews.text: The Old Town is ok with Bars and Restaurants and some market stalls but not much else. Cheap to eat and drink if you look around and use some of the bars in the old town,
reviews.title: Good Hotel (not sure about place)
70 euro is competitive
reviews.text: Be warned if flying with Air Baltic , they now have a max of 8kg weight on luggage, I was one kg over and was charged £ 35.00 which I was not to impressed with. They even charge you £9.00 to check in in at the front desk. On the way back I was under the 8kg got checked in , and to the boarding gate when they suddenly appeared with the bag measuring equipment and duly made everyone go through getting the bags checked again . As you can imagine , chaos ensued with people asking how they managed to get through check in where the bags were deems to be ok , only to have to go through this once again. Lots of moaning and resulted in the flight being delayed.
So overall good hotel, Riga is Ok, cheap drink and food , Air Baltic are the worst airline I have ever traveled with.
reviews.title: Classic and luxurious hotel

reviews.text: Positive: The location of the hotel is very good, very close to the old town center. The interiors and its design are perfectly great, especially the hotel bar is very stylish. The rooms are nice and the breakfast buffet is great
reviews.title: extremely loud, impossible to sleep

reviews.text: Negative: THE NOISE!!!! The first and hopefully hotel experience, when I did not sleep at all!!! Downstairs in the hotel there is a karaoke bar and a casino! The music was very very loud – it felt like next door and made it totally impossible to sleep even with the earplugs until some 3 o’clock every night (and it was April so still off season for Riga, during summer the parties are supposed to go on until the very morning). Absolutely no go!!! I regret it so much to have booked a room for 3 sleepless nights!
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel, fully renovated old building.

reviews.text: We had three nights at this very central located old Hotel, previously private owned by Benjamins family for centuries. Excellent service and very well kitchen, "home taste"! Location just a few minutes walk from "Old Town" and the central station, as well the large well known Riga market. Our room at 2nd floor was very light coloured, good beds and with a large good bathroom. All international TV-channels, unfortunately not Norwegian channels.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: City trip to Riga, arrived at hotel, amazed by its grandeur. Very nice staff. The room was not huge but more than sufficient, with comfortable beds.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the hotel the old and beautiful city centre is a couple of minutes walking. Also the art-nouveau area, as well as the old Russian area of Riga is within walking distance.
reviews.title: Basic room, but nice spaces.

description: Europa Royale in Riga is not just an average 4* hotel. It is an historic and cultural monument of national importance and pride to every Riga citizen. The building dates back to 1876 and once was owned by uncrowned royal couple of Latvia, Emilija and Antons Benjamins. We offer you a unique possibility to touch and find magnificent treasures like largest Venetian chandelier in the entire Baltic region, restored fireplaces, original ceiling decor, wooden staircase, stained glass.
